intro: Stapletonia seshagiriania, commonly known as the Seshagiria stapletonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
